page.title: 01Local History
page.content: Hundon is an ancient village pre-dating the Norman Conquest. It is mentioned in the original Domesday Book. The name may have come from "Hunasdene", Huna's Valley or the Valley of the Huna.It suggests that the occupants of the valley were fierce, warlike people from across the North Sea. They were possibly descended from an ancient Asiatic nomad race who invaded Europe in4th and 5th Century. There have been significant social changes in the life of the inhabitants of the village which are reflected in the change of commercial use of the buildings. e.g. circal 1885 Hundon had 10 public houses and 6 shops today 2 public houses and 2 shops
